intro: Cephalobembix, commonly known as the horned orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique, often showy flowers that feature a prominent, horn-like structure on the lip. They are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments. The botanical features of Cephalobembix include elongated leaves and intricate floral structures that attract specific pollinators. Due to their rarity and specific habitat requirements, many species within this genus are considered endangered.
